data.title: Love this place!
data.text: I have been going to the Ohio Theatre since I was a kid. It is such a historical and magical place. Come for the entertainment, but stay for the ambiance.

data.title: Brings back memories from childhood
data.text:
We attended the Beethoven concert this fall and it was wonderful. The building is historical and the music never disappoints. I grew up coming here with my father every weekend during season for the Symphony as he had season tickets. I really missed it. You can easily purchase tickets to just one concert online. They frequently have guest musicians and tonight we had a Trio of Violin (Alicia Hui), Cello (Luis Biava) and the Piano (Caroline Hong) with Peter Stafford Wilson as the conductor.

Below is what was played this evening:

Beethoven:  Symphony No. 2 in D Major, Op. 36

Beethoven:  Concerto in C Major for Piano, Violin, Cello, and Orchestra, Op. 56 ("Triple")

Intermission 

Beethoven:  Symphony No. 7 in A Major, Op. 92

data.title: Beautiful
data.text: Attended the special session of the State Supreme Court for my son's swearing in as a lawyer. The organ music was beautiful and the inside is beautiful. It made the waiting go quickly. There is so much to see. I would enjoy having the opportunity to see a play or musical there.

data.title: Wonderful Experience
data.text: I've been to a number of events in this historic, restored theater and it is always a delight. The decor is classic and sumptuous. Just walking into the auditorium gives you the feeling that something special is about to happen. It literally sets the stage for a nice afternoon or evening out. Take advantage of their well-planned season.

data.title: Magnificent
data.text:
I can't wait for the CAPA summer movie series next year. A great theater to watch old movies in this grand venue!!  If they have tours next year, I suggest taking a tour of this theater.
Also a great theater to see Broadway productions.
Underground parking is available under the State House, across the street for five dollars for the movies.Tickets are four dollars, seniors are three dollars or a strip of ten tickets for $25 dollars.

data.title: Great theatre
data.text: I have been here many, many times over the course of 40 years for a variety of functions, i.e., movies, shows, concerts.  It is lovely and the sound is great.

data.title: Historical theatre
data.text: Magnificently restored historical theatre in the downtown area of Columbus.  Acoustics are great and there is not a bad seat in the theatre.  Close to downtown restaurants and attractions.  Theatre is also close to many hotels and close to the bus line.

data.title: Date
data.text: Went to see a play with my wife. I'm not a play guy but it's my wife's thing. The seats were comfortable and the bathroom clean. Sound system was great we could hear very clear what was being said. Good time.

data.title: Beautiful Theater
data.text: I have been to this Theater many times. It is so beautiful inside. It is hard to believe it was almost torn down. Many off Broadway shows play here. Before each show you will be entertained by music from an original pipe organ. Check out the summer movie series where you can watch movies from the past play out on the big screen.

data.title: Enjoyable
data.text: Heart of downtown.  Lots of class and charm.  Has a lot of old world charm while also having contemporary components.  Great venue for an evening out.

data.title: Always a great time!
data.text:
The Ohio Theater affords you the opportunity to be up close and personal withe the entertainers-plays- musical groups
or old movies always a good time!

data.title: Great Shows!
data.text: Ohio Theatre has a wonderful selection of shows.  I especially enjoy the Symphony Chorus! Seating needs updated... some seats are pretty bad.

data.title: Wicked play
data.text: This was my first time at The Ohio Theater. We went to see Wicked. The theater ceiling inside reminds you of being inside an old palace.  Very beautiful. The play was actually awesome. I was skeptical before hand whether i would like the play. I found myself intrigued and laughing during the play. The actors were very good in their respective roles and the play was spectacular. Would go back to watch another play. Maybe The Nut Cracker. I highly recommend going to see Wicked.

data.title: Great old theatre to watch any kind of  performance
data.text: The Ohio Theater is right across from the State House so underground parking available.  I have been here a hundred times plus. Les Miserables, Lion King, Columbus Symphony....It's a preserved movie theatre from the twenties....velvet, gold chandeliers, lovely ambiance.  Worth a visit to see the inside even if you are not going to a show.

data.title: Broadway season ticket holders
data.text: Ed and I have been broadway season tickets holders for about four years.   We never tire of sitting in the Ohio Theatre, enjoying the ambience and seeing great entertainment.  Columbus has lots of options!

data.title: I Love this place!
data.text: This place just makes me happy being there & brings back so many wonderful memories from my childhood with my grandma to romantic evenings with my husband.  I use any excuse to come here & usually the show is worth it, but I wouldn't even care if it wasn't cause then I would just stare @ the ceiling.

data.title: historical
data.text: an  amazing theater to watch  a musical. I've been several times and the architecture is awesome to look at prior to the show. the  acoustics are fantastic and the seats are old school velvet. there's a nice bar during intermission.

data.title: Spectacular Sensory Experience for Eyes and Ears
data.text: Visiting the Ohio Theater is like being transported into a Spanish-Baroque work of art where the opulence of the venue was as important as the show itself. From the gilded gold and aluminum leaf ceiling to the masterfully-crafted portico's and state-of-the art sound system, the theater provides the audience with a visual and auditory experience that immerses them into any event. We've been lucky enough to have had the opportunity to experience a number of musicals there, including West Side Story and Wicked, and highly recommend the venue to locals and visitors.

data.title: It's not New York, But it is great Broadway!
data.text: Me & my wife have always wanted to go to a Broadway show, but with not being able to go to New York City anytime soon, I saw a commercial about a Broadway show at Ohio Theater and I thought, Why Not?  We loved it!  We have been to 2 so far now, The Lion King & Dirty Dancing The Tour.  Were hooked.  Looking forward to attending more at this great theater.  Haven't had a bad seat yet!

data.title: Beautiful Theater
data.text: We've been to the Ohio Theater several times to see the Musicals.  It is one of the prettiest places I have seen.  The seating is great and comfortable as well.  If you sit too close to the front, the sound can be a little loud, but it's worth it.  It's definitely a place to see if you've never been there before.
